arm_group.description: Those suspected of sleep apnea and scheduled for polysomnography and treated with CPAP therapy.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to check blood and urine levels to further define markers/tests
      in the blood and urine that would be useful in following patients with obstructive sleep
      apnea and then to see if by wearing CPAP every night, these markers can be reduced. This
      research is being done because currently there are no effective blood or urine markers to
      determine how well CPAP is working.

clinical_study.brief_title: Oxidative Stress in Obstructive Sleep Apnea: Correlation of Biomarkers and Nasal CPAP Compliance

detailed_description.textblock:
The goal of this study is to further define biomarkers that would be useful in following
      patients with obstructive sleep apnea and examining their response to compliance to therapy
      with CPAP.  To date no correlation between biomarkers of oxidative stress and compliance to
      CPAP has been measured.  CPAP is the most effective treatment for obstructive sleep apnea
      and has been show to reduce blood pressure and decrease oxidative stress.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Men and Women over 18 years suspected of having sleep apnea

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Those under 18 years or not suspected of having sleep apnea

study_pop.textblock: Those over 18 years suspected of having sleep apnea.

clinical_study.official_title: Oxidative Stress in Obstructive Sleep Apnea: Correlation of Biomarkers and Nasal CPAP Compliance

primary_outcome.description: The primary objective of this pilot study will determine the biomarkers for polysomnography characteristics with CPAP treatment from baseline to 6 months in patients with obstructive sleep apnea. The results will guide biomarker selection for full scale studies.
primary_outcome.measure: Determining biomarkers for polysomnography characteristics before and after CPAP treatment

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective
